title: Classic Roast Chicken
description: A simple and delicious roast chicken with crispy skin and juicy meat. Perfect for Sunday dinner.
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Remove giblets from chicken cavity and pat chicken dry with paper towels.
Rub chicken all over with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place lemon halves, garlic, rosemary, and thyme inside the cavity.
Place chicken breast-side up in a roasting pan.
Roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until juices run clear and internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.

title: Chicken Parmesan
description: Breaded chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted cheese. An Italian-American favorite!
steps: Pound chicken breasts to an even 1/4-inch thickness.
Set up breading station: flour in one dish, beaten eggs in another, and breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan in a third.
Dredge each chicken breast in flour, then egg, then breadcrumb mixture.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Cook chicken until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Place chicken in a baking dish, top each piece with marinara sauce and mozzarella slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until cheese is bubbly and chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

title: Butter Chicken
description: Tender chicken in a rich, creamy tomato sauce with aromatic Indian spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
steps: In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, garam masala, cumin, and turmeric.
Add chicken pieces to the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (overnight is better).
In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and ginger, cooking until softened.
Add marinated chicken and cook until no longer pink on the outside, about 5 minutes.
Pour in tomato puree, bring to a simmer, and cook for 15 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and continue simmering for another 10 minutes until sauce thickens and chicken is fully cooked.
Adjust salt to taste and garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve with naan bread or rice.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry
description: Quick and healthy chicken stir-fry with colorful vegetables in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken breast, thinly sliced
1 teaspoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry until no longer pink, about 4-5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the wok. Add garlic and ginger, stir-frying for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Return chicken to the wok. Add soy sauce and oyster sauce, tossing to combine.
Stir in cornstarch slurry and cook until sauce thickens, about 1 minute.
Remove from heat, drizzle with sesame oil, and garnish with green onions.
Serve over steamed rice.

title: Chicken Enchiladas
description: Tender shredded chicken rolled in tortillas, topped with enchilada sauce and melted cheese.
ingredients: 2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine shredded chicken, 1/2 cup enchilada sauce, onion, green chilies, garlic, cumin, oregano, and 1 cup cheese.
Pour 1/2 cup enchilada sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla.
Roll up tortillas and place seam-side down in the baking dish.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake 10 more minutes until cheese is bubbly.
Serve with sour cream, cilantro, and avocado slices.

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
description: Comforting homemade chicken soup with tender chunks of chicken, vegetables, and egg noodles.
ingredients: 1 whole chicken (3-4 pounds), cut into pieces
steps: Place chicken pieces in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes, skimming foam as needed.
Remove chicken from pot and set aside to cool slightly.
Strain broth and return to pot. Add onion, carrots, celery, garlic, bay leaves, and thyme.
Simmer vegetables in broth for 20 minutes until tender.
Meanwhile, remove chicken meat from bones and shred into bite-sized pieces.
Add egg noodles to the pot and cook according to package directions, usually 6-8 minutes.
Return shredded chicken to the pot and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove bay leaves, stir in fresh herbs, and serve hot.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Grilled marinated chicken chunks in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce. A popular Indian dish with British roots.
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
steps: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, half the garlic, half the ginger, 1 teaspoon each of cumin, coriander, and garam masala, and all the turmeric and paprika.
Add chicken to the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with foil.
Arrange marinated chicken on the baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes until edges start to brown.
In a large pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, remaining garlic and ginger, and cook until softened.
Add remaining cumin, coriander, and garam masala. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tomato sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in cooked chicken and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Add heavy cream, simmer for 5 more minutes, and add salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken
description: Fresh and zesty grilled chicken marinated in lemon, garlic, and herbs. Perfect for summer cookouts.
steps: In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken in a zip-top bag and pour marinade over it. Seal and massage to coat chicken evenly.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably 4-6 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat (about 375-400°F or 190-205°C).
Remove chicken from marinade and discard remaining marinade.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Garnish with fresh lemon slices and additional herbs if desired.

title: Chicken Fajitas
description: Sizzling spiced chicken strips with bell peppers and onions, served with warm tortillas and toppings.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced into strips
Sour cream, guacamole, salsa, and shredded cheese for serving
steps: In a small bowl, mix chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, paprika, cayenne (if using), salt, and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss chicken strips with 1 tablespoon oil, lime juice, and spice mixture. Let marinate for 15-30 minutes.
Heat remaining oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Add chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until no longer pink. Remove from pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add bell peppers and onions. Cook for 4-5 minutes until slightly softened but still crisp.
Return chicken to the pan and toss everything together for another minute.
Serve immediately with warm tortillas and desired toppings.

title: Chicken Pot Pie
description: A comforting classic with tender chicken, vegetables, and creamy sauce baked under a flaky crust.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, diced
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large saucepan, cook diced chicken until no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Gradually add chicken broth, stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Add heavy cream.
Cook until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes, then stir in chicken, peas, corn, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Line a 9-inch pie dish with one pie crust. Pour in chicken mixture.
Top with second pie crust, seal edges, and cut slits in the top for steam to escape.
Brush with beaten egg and bake for 35-40 minutes until crust is golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Honey Garlic Chicken
description: Sweet and sticky chicken with a delicious honey garlic glaze. Quick, easy, and irresistible!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
steps: Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from pan.
In the same pan, reduce heat to medium and add garlic. Cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add honey, soy sauce, and rice vinegar. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Stir in cornstarch slurry and cook until sauce thickens, about 1-2 minutes.
Return chicken to the pan, turning to coat in the sauce. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes if desired, garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve over rice or with steamed vegetables.

title: Buffalo Chicken Wings
description: Spicy, tangy chicken wings tossed in classic buffalo sauce. Perfect for game day!
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken wings, split at joints, tips removed
Blue cheese or ranch dressing for serving
Celery and carrot sticks for serving
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top.
Pat wings dry with paper towels. In a large bowl, toss wings with oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Arrange wings in a single layer on the rack.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, turning halfway through, until wings are crispy and reach an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
While wings are baking, make the buffalo sauce by combining hot sauce, melted butter, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce in a bowl.
When wings are done, transfer to a large bowl and pour sauce over them. Toss until evenly coated.
Serve immediately with blue cheese or ranch dressing and vegetable sticks.

title: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: Crisp romaine lettuce with grilled chicken, Parmesan cheese, croutons, and creamy Caesar dressing.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, shaved or grated
Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Season chicken breasts with olive oil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Grill chicken over medium-high heat for 6-7 minutes per side, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
For the dressing, whisk together mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking. Stir in Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss chopped romaine with enough dressing to coat lightly.
Top with chicken strips, shaved Parmesan, and croutons.
Serve with additional dressing on the side if desired.

title: Chicken Biryani
description: Fragrant Indian rice dish with spiced chicken, caramelized onions, and aromatic herbs.
ingredients: Saffron strands soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk
steps: Wash rice until water runs clear. Soak in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
In a pot, bring 8 cups water and 1 teaspoon salt to a boil. Add rice and cook until 70% done, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a bowl, mix chicken with yogurt, half the garlic and ginger, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half and set aside.
Add ghee, remaining garlic and ginger, green chilies, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and bay leaf to the pot.
Add marinated chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Add biryani masala and cook for another 5 minutes.
Layer half the rice over the chicken, sprinkle half the mint, cilantro, and fried onions.
Add remaining rice, then top with remaining herbs, fried onions, and saffron milk.
Cover tightly with foil, then place the lid on. Cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes.
Let rest for 10 minutes before gently mixing the layers and serving.

title: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
description: Creamy pasta with tender chicken in a rich Parmesan cream sauce. A restaurant-quality dish made at home.
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water before draining.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 5-7 minutes per side until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Remove chicken, let rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add heavy cream, bring to a simmer, and cook for 5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Whisk in Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg until smooth.
If sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water a little at a time to reach desired consistency.
Add cooked pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat completely.
Top with sliced chicken and garnish with parsley before serving.

title: Teriyaki Chicken
description: Sweet and savory Japanese-inspired chicken glazed with homemade teriyaki sauce.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sake (Japanese rice wine) or dry sherry
2 teaspoons cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon water
steps: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger.
Reserve 1/3 cup of the sauce for glazing later.
Add chicken to the remaining sauce and marinate for at least 30 minutes, preferably 2-4 hours.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade (discard used marinade) and cook for 5-6 minutes per side until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a small saucepan, bring reserved sauce to a simmer. Add cornstarch slurry and cook for 1-2 minutes until thickened.
Brush glaze over cooked chicken or toss chicken in the sauce.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.
Serve hot over steamed rice.
